page.title: 14HOUSES IN ORPINGTON
page.content: {Orpington} is mainly a {residential area} developed in the 1930s to meet the demands caused by the outward movement from London. It is a typical suburban development being made up of detached and semi-detached houses being well appointed and having large gardens. Today some of the large detached houses are being demolished to make way for new developments. The demand for houses in Orpington is high and prices reflect this having risen dramatically over the last ten years. The expansion of residential development has been restricted by the Green Belt but nevertheless Orpington's urban landscape has been described as a {"boring procession of middle class housing"}. The older Victorian housing is found in St.Mary Cray which was the main village before the growth of Orpington.
